intro: Actinostemma paniculatum, commonly known as the panicled actinostemma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in compound umbels, which are typical of the family. Its leaves are usually pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Actinostemma paniculatum is often grown for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained, sunny soils.
